title: Antonio Gramsci
summary: Antonio Francesco Gramsci (UK: /ˈɡræmʃi/,[5] US: /ˈɡrɑːmʃi/;[6] Italian: [anˈtɔːnjo franˈtʃesko ˈɡramʃi] (listen); 22 January 1891 – 27 April 1937) was an Italian  Marxist philosopher, journalist, linguist, writer, and politician. He wrote on philosophy, political theory, sociology, history, and linguistics. He was a founding member and one-time leader of the Communist Party of Italy and was imprisoned by Benito Mussolini's Fascist regime.
